title: People who listened to grunge in the 90s, what have you been listening to since the genre’s decline? - Quora

response.answer_text: Grunge was just a few years we have had nearly 25 years of rock since why people have to be so fixated by genre? So excluding all the many other kinds of music I have listened to since then, here is a rock band for every year since in approx order Green Day, Blink 182, Queens Of The Stone Age, The Offspring, Deftones, System Of A Down, Linkin Park, Incubus,The Darkness, Biffy Clyro, Jimmy Eat World, Brand New, New Found Glory, Evanscence, Fall Out Boy, Panic At The Disco, My Chemical Romance, Paramore,You Me At Six, Mallory Knox,Royal Blood,We Are The Ocean, Lonely The Brave,Nothing But Thieves,Bring Me The Horizon, Notice something the US has fallen of the map in Rock, all the best rock has come from the UK in the last ten years, check some of it out. For the future check out Marmozets, Tonight Alive and Moose Blood.

I grew up in the 90's…graduated high school in ’94 and then college in ‘97…so I was pretty familiar with Pearl Jam, Alice In Chains and Nirvana…but when I finally made it out of my parent's house and struck out on my own, I had a boyfriend with great taste in music. This was 2002 or so. He introduced me to System of A Down and Godsmack and Tool and Korn…which I immediately loved because I knew it would drive Mom and Dad insane…but it felt like my eyes (and ears) were opened. I loved it all because I was newly emancipated and for the first time in my life, I was making my own decisions. Yay, music!! ^_^
